thread.title: Pospisil beats Giraldo in first round of the Valencia Open
thread.title_full: Pospisil beats Giraldo in first round of the Valencia Open

title: Pospisil beats Giraldo in first round of the Valencia Open
text:
Pospisil beats Giraldo in first round of the Valencia Open THE ASSOCIATED PRESS First Posted: October 26, 2015 - 12:54 pmLast Updated: October 26, 2015 - 12:54 pm We also have more stories about: (click the phrases to see a list) 
People: 
Spain (180) 

VALENCIA, Spain — Vasek Pospisil advanced to the second round of the Valenica Open following a 6-4, 6-3 win over Santiago Giraldo on Monday. 
Pospisil, the fifteenth-seeded Canadian, had won all three of his previous matches against the Colombian. 
Extending that record proved straightforward, as Pospisil used his big serve and powerful forehand to good effect, wrapping up the victory in 1 hour and 10 minutes. 
"I played pretty well overall and did a good job despite a few nerves at the end," Pospisil said. 
"I came up with some good points and great shots and that was the key to the match." 
The 25-year-old Pospisil held his serve to love in his opening three service games before breaking Giraldo in the tenth game for the opening set. 
Although the South American offered a stern resistance in the second, saving four break points in a marathon 10 minute sixth game, Pospisil eventually served out the match. 
He next faces Jeremy Chardy of France or Great Britain's Aljaz Bedene.
